headline: Who is Daniel Foganholi, the new Broward School Board member appointed by DeSantis?
author: Jimena Tavel
sentences:
When he announced his campaign for state Senate on his LinkedIn page about three months ago, Foganholi wrote: The number one question Ive been getting is WHY? The answer is simple, I love helping people.?
He also added: My parents came to America from Brazil with a dream to build a better future for our family.

We have an opportunity to make history this year and we will!?
Foganholi will represent District 5 on the School Board, which goes from northwest Fort Lauderdale to east Sunrise, and from southwest Oakland Park to northeast Plantation.
He also is the director of strategic partnerships for the Brazilian American Coalition, a nonprofit that helps Brazilian Americans, according to a press release sent by the governors office.
Foganholi, who didnt respond to a request for comment from the Herald Monday, filed last November to run as a Republican for Florida Senate District 97, which covers northwest Broward.
Foganholi, who graduated from Florida Atlantic University with degrees in marketing and business management, didnt raise money in February and March, the records show.
Osgood resigned last November after nearly a decade on the board to run as a Democrat for Florida Senate District 33, which covers central Broward.
Five candidates have filed to run for the seat, which the winning candidate would occupy for a two-year term, county election records show.
Foganholi, 36, works as a design consultant for Arhaus, an Ohio-based retail chain that designs and sells furniture.
Ron DeSantis appointed her replacement Friday: Daniel Foganholi, a Coral Springs resident of Brazilian descent.
Nearly two months after Rosalind Osgoods final meeting as a Broward School Board member in early March, Gov.
As of Monday, May 2, Foganholi was not one of the five announced candidates running for the District 5 seat.
District 5 voters will choose who will represent them in the Nov. 8 general election.
In December and January, he raised $1,810 for his campaign, state records show.
The deadline for getting onto the Broward School Board ballot is mid-June.
She won the primary in January and the general election March 8.
His campaign website, however, wasnt working Monday.
He will serve until Osgoods term ends in November.
Its unclear if he will still pursue that seat.
This is what America is about.
